name: Wingspan
premise: Players are bird enthusiasts who seek to discover and attract the best birds to their network of wildlife preserves.
description: Wingspan is a competitive, medium-weight, card-driven, engine-building board game. Each bird extends a chain of powerful combinations in one of your habitats (actions).
session_playtime_notes: Game duration can vary based on player count and strategy.
immersiveness_level_notes: The game's artwork and components contribute to its immersive qualities.
learning_curve_notes: Gameplay is easy to understand, but strategy can take time to master.
save_mechanism_notes: The game is typically played in one session.
how_to_win: The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.
how_to_lose: Players can't lose per se, but they can end up with fewer points than their opponents.

reasons: Wingspan's beautifully illustrated bird cards and the gorgeous components could greatly appeal to those with an artistic inclination.
The game's thematic integration, involving attracting various species of birds to habitats, might resonate with individuals who appreciate creativity and imagination.
The game's strategic element, involving managing resources and planning ahead to maximize points, could appeal to those with a problem-solving mindset.

Its engine-building mechanics, where each bird card you play can chain with existing cards for better effects, can be engaging for individuals who enjoy understanding and implementing efficient solutions.
The peaceful and cooperative nature of Wingspan might appeal to INFJs who prefer non-confrontational games and enjoy contributing to a shared goal.
The theme of preserving and attracting various bird species to habitats could resonate with INFJs' altruistic and idealistic nature.

unique_selling_point: Wingspan's unique bird theme and gorgeous components make it stand out from other engine-building games.
